title: fix: unmatced subquery should return Null (not error)
body:
## Goal
Currently,
```sql
gluesql> SELECT (SELECT N FROM SERIES(3) WHERE N = 4) N;
[error] nested select row not found
```
But it should be
```sql
gluesql> SELECT (SELECT N FROM SERIES(3) WHERE N = 4) N;
```
| N    |
|------|
| NULL |

It affects to scala subquery, In-List subquery.

## Todo
- [x] modify EvaluateError::NestedSelectRowNotFound to Value::Null
- [x] remove EvaluateError::NestedSelectRowNotFound

title: Expose Row to Payload::Select and add Row to core::prelude
body:
prev
```rust
Payload::Select {
  labels: Vec<String>,
  rows: Vec<Vec<Value>>,
}
```

now
```rust
Payload::Select {
  labels: Vec<String>,
  rows: Vec<Row>,
}
```

Expose `Row` struct to user-side, add `Row` to `core::prelude`.
`Row` was being used only for internal core development because it was just a thin wrapper of `Vec<Value>`.
However, we can expect to provide some useful helper functions to users using `Row` and more importantly, `Row` will have more than a single variant of `Vec<Value>` when we add schemaless feature to our core.

title: Add support `GLUE_INDEXES` reserved table which provides all index info
body:
## Goal
```sql
gluesql> CREATE TABLE Foo(id INT PRIMARY KEY, name TEXT);
gluesql> CREATE INDEX Foo_id_1 ON Foo (id + 1);
gluesql> CREATE INDEX Foo_name_concat ON Foo (name + '_');
gluesql> SELECT * FROM GLUE_INDEXES;
```
| TABLE_NAME | INDEX_NAME     | ORDER | EXPRESSION | UNIQUENESS |
|------------|----------------|-------|------------|------------|
| Foo        | PRIMARY        | BOTH  | id         | TRUE       |
| Foo        | Foo_id_1       | BOTH  | id + 1     | FALSE      |
| Foo        | Foo_name_concat | BOTH  | name + "_" | FALSE      |

## Todo
- [x] implement GLUE_INDEXES
- [x] PK should be included in GLUE_INDEXES as `UNIQUENESS` column

## In Next
- Unique Index
- Composite Index
- GLUE_INDEX_COLUMNS(EXPRESSIONS?)
- 🤔 Why don't ASC, DESC  work? => future works up to storage type
- adjust GLUE_INDEXES to show indexes from {TABLE_NAME}
- looks like CREATE INDEX {INDEX_NAME} ON {TABLE_NAME} (`FUNCTION(COLUMN)`) does not work

title: Update ast-builder function expr params to use `Into<..Node>`
body:
In this PR, there exists still remaining `ExprNode` params which is not replaced by `Into<ExprNode>`.
e.g.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2025065/195250776-1aa3a729-3c93-446b-8d08-0bbc00eac3e2.png)

In the case of `Option<ExprNode>`, If we change it into `Option<Into<ExprNode>>`, then the compiler cannot infer type of `None` without type annotation.
We need to find better ways to resolve this later.

title: Add setting table_alias support to AST builder table init function
body:
Add `TableAliasNode` which supports setting table alias for source tables.

```rust
table("Bar").alias_as("b").select()
```
This above is identical to the below SQL query
```sql
SELECT * FROM Bar b;
```

title: Grouping `GlueSQL` projects into `pkg/*` per language
Implement hash join support to AST builder
body:
Add `HashJoinNode` to Select FSM.
`HashJoinNode` provides users to set hash join execution plan manually without running join planner.

e.g.
```rust
table("Player")
    .select()
    .join("PlayerItem")
    .hash_executor("PlayerItem.user_id", "Player.id")
    .hash_filter("PlayerItem.rate > 4.5")
    .on("PlayerItem.flag IS NOT NULL")
    .build();
```

cc. @seonghun-dev

title: Implement macro that implements `TryBinaryOperator`,
body:
1. In the binary operator of numeric , always calculate by changing `Rhs` based on the type of `Lhs`.
2. Only `try_multiply` is implemented for the `Interval` type, and the `Interval` type currently uses `std::ops::Mul` because there is no wrapping implementation for `checked_*` .
3. The `checked_*` functions only exist for integers, not floats. A float is converted to inf when it overflows. So we created a new `integer` module.

title: [AST-Builder] Impl Case
body:
## Description
Implement ast-builder case expression.
There are two entry points for case expr. 
1. `ExprNode`.case()... : Case expr with operand
2. case()...  : Case expr without operand

## Detail - mini FSM
(ExprNode) -> CaseNode -> `when_then` ->  WhenThenNode 
-> 1. `(or_else, end)` ->  ExprNode 
-> 2. `when_then` -> WhenThenNode

## Reference
https://github.com/gluesql/gluesql/pull/708  @woojinnn

title: [AST] Support `ArrayIndex`Expr
body:
## Issue
resolves #827 

## Detail
ArrayIndex Expr works for accessing value from `List`, `Map` type value. ex) `map["1"]["2"]`
The internal behavior is a bit different from `unwrap` fn. 
1. return `Err` when value is not selectable 
  cf. `unwrap` also works the same at first time but returns `Value::Null` when recursively applied.
2. return `Value::Null` when accessing non-existent key from `List`, `Map` value

title: Implement str_position function under enum Value
body:
## Background
for #855 

### mysql POSITION function return examples
```sql
SELECT POSITION("h" IN "sushi") AS MatchPosition;
```
|MatchPosition|
|----------------|
|4|

```sql
SELECT POSITION("" IN "sushi") AS MatchPosition;
```
|MatchPosition|
|----------------|
|1|

```sql
SELECT POSITION(NULL IN "sushi") AS MatchPosition;
```
|MatchPosition|
|----------------|
|NULL|

```sql
SELECT POSITION(-1 IN "sushi") AS MatchPosition;
```
|MatchPosition|
|----------------|
|0|

```sql
SELECT POSITION(2022-09-25 IN "sushi") AS MatchPosition;
```
|MatchPosition|
|----------------|
|0|

## Description
Added function to support mysql's `POSITION` function.

Since the substring and string to be parsed and received as an argument in the sql statement are value types in glusql, the str_position function has been implemented for the operation.

If `empty_string` found in arguments, I64(0) is returned.
If `substring in string found`, the position of the first occurrence is returned. The minimum value is I64(1).
If `NULL found` in arguments, Null is returned. 
Although mysql returns 0 for other types of arguments, I decided to display an Error for types other than string and null.

## Tasks
- [x] Write implementation
- [x] Add unit, doc Tests
- [x] Add Error

title: Update test-suite Tester trait to use Glue struct
Support `.edit {fileName|None}` in CLI
body:
To resolve #870 

## Implement
### 1. Open temporary editor with last SQL
```
$> cargo run
gluesql> .run
[error] Nothing in SQL history to run.
gluesql> SELECT 1, 'a', true
```
| 1 | 'a' | true |
|---|-----|------|
| 1 | a   | TRUE |
```
gluesql> .edit
```
=> open Editor with last command on temporary file like /tmp/Glue_****.sql

```sql
-- modify in editor
SELECT 1, 'a', true, 2, 'b'
```
If you want to fix editor type, run below command on OS
```sh
# (optional)
$> export EDITOR=vi
```
```
gluesql> .run
```
| 1 | 'a' | true | 2 | 'b' |
|---|-----|------|---|-----|
| 1 | a   | TRUE | 2 | b   |
### 2. Open editor with physical file
```
gluesql> .edit foo.sql
```
```sql
-- modify in editor
SELECT 1 AS no, 'In physical file' AS name
```
```
gluesql> .execute foo.sql
```
| no | name             |
|----|------------------|
| 1  | In physical file |

title: Support Dictionary(Schema) view
body:
## Goal
Support Dictionary view to get schema information.
```sql
gluesql> SELECT * FROM GLUE_TABLES;
```
| TABLE_NAME |
|------------|
| Bar        |
| Foo        |
```sql
gluesql> SELECT * FROM GLUE_TABLE_COLUMNS;
```
| TABLE_NAME | COLUMN_NAME | COLUMN_ID |
|------------|-------------|-----------|
| Bar        | id          | 1         |
| Bar        | name        | 2         |
| Bar        | type        | 3         |
| Foo        | id          | 1         |
| Foo        | name        | 2         |
## Todo
- [x] add TableFactor::Dictionary
- [x] implement fetch_all_schemas
- [x] implement `GLUE_TABLES`, `GLUE_TABLE_COLUMNS` 
- [x] refactor `show tables` with `fetch_all_schemas`, `show version` with direct implementation
- [x] remove feature - metadata
## References
[oracle data dictionary view](https://docs.oracle.com/cd/E11882_01/server.112/e40540/datadict.htm#CNCPT002)
[mysql data dictionary schema](https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/8.0/en/data-dictionary-schema.html)
[postgresql system catalogs](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/catalogs.html)

title: Improvement `validate_unique` function when only `PrimaryKey` exists
body:
The existing `validate_unique` function creates a unique constraint by looping through all rows even when only `PrimaryKey` exists.

Use `Store::fetch_data` to improve speed in the above situation.

title: Replace crate::`comfy-table` with `tabled`
body:
This is a prerequisite PR for #820 
To support CLI option, we decided to replace crate `comfy-table` with `tabled`

## Goal
- Apply new `tabled` to cli
- Set html as default print style like below
```sql
gluesql> SELECT * FROM (VALUES (1, 'a', true), (2, 'b', false)) AS Sub;
```
(pasted from gluesql directly)
| column1 | column2 | column3 |
|---------|---------|---------|
| 1       | a       | TRUE    |
| 2       | b       | FALSE   |
## Todo
- [x] apply crate::tabled
- [x] set html as default print style
- [x] remove crate::comfy-table 
- [x] generalize build(with_style) 
- [x] features QA
  - every features works fine!
```
"command"        ,"description"                       
".help"          ,"show help"                                                                               
".quit"          ,"quit program"                   
".tables"        ,"show table names"                                                                        
".columns TABLE" ,"show columns from TABLE"          
".version"       ,"show version"                                                                            
".execute FILE"  ,"execute SQL from a file"                                                                 
".spool FILE|off","spool to file or off" 
```

title: [Data] add data type u8
body:
## Background
### from #623 

### ref 
#### About numeric type
- [mysql](https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/8.0/en/numeric-types.html)
- [oracle](https://docs.oracle.com/cd/B19306_01/olap.102/b14346/dml_datatypes002.htm)
- [postgresql](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/9.6/datatype-numeric.html)

#### overflow handling
- [mysql](https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/8.0/en/out-of-range-and-overflow.html)
- [oracle question](https://asktom.oracle.com/pls/apex/f?p=100:11:0::::P11_QUESTION_ID:9531631800346339791)

## Description
1. When calculating arithmetic operations on u8 and i8, both are converted to i64 and calculated.
2. For the remaining types, cast to the larger type.

## Description
- implement `to_sql` functions for `create table`, `alter table` and related enum & structs in `ddl.rs`
